sen.cmt: 緩急接続 →定訳不明："Kankyu Setsuzoku" (slower and faster-train connection) とし、その後に(in a way that a slower train waits on a refuge track for a faster train to let it start first and by this, the mutual transfer becomes possible between the passengers of a slower and a faster train) と説明を加えました。
sen.e: During the daytime the up train makes a connection with a local train (that starts from and terminates at Takatsuki Station) at Ibarakishi Station, and with a semi-express train at Takatsuki Station and Katsura Station; moreover, the down train makes a "Kankyu Setsuzoku" (slower and faster train connection) with a semi-express (in such a way that a slower train waits on a refuge track for a faster train to let it start first, and by this the mutual transfer becomes possible between the passengers of a slower train and a faster train) at Katsura Station and Ibarakishi Station.

During the daytime the inbound limited express train makes a connection with a local train (that arrived at and departs from Takatsukishi Station) at Ibarakishi Station, and with a semi-express train at Takatsukishi Station and Katsura Station; moreover, the outbound limited express train makes a connection with a semi-express train at Katsura Station and Ibarakishi Station.

tit.cmt: 歌劇特急→定訳不明Kageki-tokkyu (Limited Express to Takarazuka Revue)

sen.j: 1950年から1968年まで京都～宝塚間を神戸線・今津線経由で直通する通称「歌劇特急（かげき特急）」が運転されていた。
sen.e: From 1950 to 1968, a direct train known as "Kageki-tokkyu" (limited express) was operated between Kyoto Station and Takarazuka Station through the Kobe Line and the Imazu Line.

sen.j: 運転開始当初は西宮北口駅構内に神戸方向から今津線に直通する連絡線が存在しており、列車は一旦平面交差を通過してからスイッチバックで今津線に入線していた。
sen.e: Initially, there was a connecting track inside the yard of Nishinomiya-kitaguchi Station, which was a through track proceeded from the direction of Kobe to the Imazu Line, and the train, after passing the ground crossing, switched back to enter the Imazu Line.

sen.j: 西宮北口駅大改造による宝塚線経由での運転や三複線工事による運休などを経て、神戸高速鉄道開通に伴う神戸線のダイヤ改正を目前に控えた1968年2月25日に廃止された。
sen.e: After suffering difficult operations such as the train service through devious route via the Takarazuka Line due to a large-scale reconstruction of Nishinomiya-kitaguchi Station and the suspension of the service due to the construction of the sextuple-tracked section, this train service was discontinued on February 25, 1968, immediately before the revision of the timetable was to be made following the inauguration of Kobe Rapid Transit Railway.

sen.j: しかしこれは、アメリカのインターアーバンに準ずる路面電車を発展させた形の都市間電車で、既にあった沿線の市街地を縫うように敷かれたため、曲線が多く高速運転には向いていなかった。
sen.e: However, this was an interurban transportation developed from the tramway, by taking the electric interurban railway in America as a model, and since the railway was laid as if to fill the niche through the already urbanized areas with many curves, it was not suitable for rapid transportation.

sen.e: However, this was inter-urban transportation developed from the tramway, by taking the electric inter-urban railway in America as a model; however, since the railway was laid as if to fill the niche through already urbanized areas with many curves, it wasn't suitable for rapid transportation.

sen.j: この様子を阪急の免許申請時から見ていた京阪電気鉄道では、自社の路線においてもそのような事態になることを避けるため、おりしも電気鉄道の敷設がブームであり、淀川の北側の人口過疎地域に阪急神戸線と同じような高速運転可能な路線の敷設出願が各社から出されていたのに対して、京阪自身も出願を行った。
sen.e: Observing this situation, Keihan Electric Railway tried to avoid a similar complication over its line, and observing that the electric railway construction had started a boom, it decided to apply for a high-speed railway construction, just like the one that the Hankyu Kobe Line had achieved, in the underpopulated area on the north of Yodo-gawa River, for which various companies had already filed the application.

sen.e: At that time, Japanese Government Railways (JGR), which was in charge of the management of Japan National Railway (JNR) and the jurisdictional control of private railways, was also anxious about possible severe competitions between railway companies, like the one that Hanshin and Hankyu were having.

sen.j: 当初は京阪本線森小路駅（現在の千林駅に相当）から支線を分岐させて、新京阪線上新庄駅予定地から南へ延長した路線に赤川で合流させ、城東線（後の大阪環状線）桜ノ宮駅・天満駅を経由して梅田まで延伸し、同地に総合ターミナル駅を作ろうという構想（天神橋駅開業後に京阪本線は野江駅分岐、新京阪線は天神橋駅からの延伸に計画変更し、1932年に断念、1942年に免許失効。京阪梅田線も参照）を打ち出したが、城東線の高架化が関東大震災復興工事優先投資の方針から遅れることになったため、梅田延伸に関して高架化に伴う跡地の利用を考えていた京阪では、この新線は当面は実現不可能と考えて、代替地を探すことにした。
sen.e: Initial plan was as follows: bifurcate a feeder line from Morikoji Station on the Keihan Main Line (corresponding to current Senbayashi Station); at Akagawa, connect it with the line proceeding from the project site of Kami-shinjo Station to the south; then extend the line to Umeda Station via Sakuranomiya Station and Temma Station on the Joto Line (later Osaka Loop Line); at Umeda Station, construct a general terminal station (after the inauguration of Tenjinbashi Station, the plan was changed to bifurcate the Keihan Main Line at Noe Station and extend the Shinkeihan Line from Tenjinbashi Station, but the plan was abandoned in 1932, and the license was lapsed in 1942, see also the section of "Keihan Umeda Line"); however, since the elevation of the Joto Line was postponed because of the investment policy which prioritized the reconstruction of The Great Kanto Earthquake, Keihan, which was anticipating to extend the line up to Umeda Station, making use of the site of the Joto Line after it was once elevated, decided to look for an alternate site, based on the perspective that this new line project would not be feasible for a while.
sen.cmt: 大阪環状線→Osaka Loop Line [http://www.westjr.co.jp/english/travel/kix/index.html]関東大震災→The Great Kanto Earthquake [英辞郎on the WEB, プログレッシブ和英中辞典]
sen.e: The initial plan was as follows: bifurcate a feeder line from Morikoji Station on the Keihan Main Line (corresponding to current Senbayashi Station); at Akagawa, connect it with the line proceeding from the project site of Kami-shinjo Station to the south, and then extend the line to Umeda Station via Sakuranomiya Station and Temma Station on the Joto Line (later Osaka Loop Line); at Umeda Station, construct a general terminal station (after the inauguration of Tenjinbashi Station; the plan was changed to bifurcate the Keihan Main Line at Noe Station and extend the Shinkeihan Line from Tenjinbashi Station, but the plan was abandoned in 1932 and the license was lapsed in 1942 (see also the section of "Keihan Umeda Line"); however, since the elevation of the Joto Line was postponed due to the investment policy that prioritized the reconstruction of the Great Kanto Earthquake, Keihan, which had anticipated extending the line up to Umeda Station by making use of the site of the Joto Line once it was elevated, decided to look for an alternate site, based on the perspective that this new line project wouldn't be feasible for some time.

sen.j: ちょうど新京阪線の計画がたった頃の1921年に、阪急神戸線・阪急宝塚本線の十三駅から分岐して千里山駅までを結ぶ、北大阪電気鉄道（現在淡路駅を境に、西は京都線、北は阪急千里線）という私鉄路線が開業していた。
sen.e: In 1921, just around when the construction project of the Shinkeihan Line was formulated, a private railway called Kita-Osaka Electric Railway began operating with the line diverging from the Hankyu Kobe Line and Hankyu Takarazuka Main Line at Juso Station, and reaching up to Senriyama Station (at present the line was divided into two sections at Awaji Station, and the west section belongs to the Kyoto Line and the North section to the Hankyu Senri Line).

sen.e: After that, along the section of the Kyoto side, there was a plan to open the line with underground tracks, however the plan was changed to hastily construct a provisional terminal station at Saiin to meet the state-funded Enthronement Ceremony of Emperor Showa, and in 1928 the whole section of the line between Tenjinbashi Station and Saiin Station began full operation.

tit.j: 京阪電気鉄道への統合

sen.j: しかし昭和金融恐慌・世界恐慌の影響で、この新京阪鉄道や阪和電気鉄道（現：阪和線）・奈良電気鉄道（現：近鉄京都線）などに多額の投資をした京阪電気鉄道の経営が危うくなった。
sen.e: However, affected by the Showa Depression and the Great Depression, Keihan Electric Railway, which was investing heavily in Shinkeihan Railway, Hanwa Electric Railway (current Hanwa Line) and Nara Electric Railway (current Kintetsu Kyoto Line) among others, ran into financial difficulty.

sen.j: その上、新京阪鉄道の路線は京都側のターミナルが仮の西院駅で、大阪側の天神橋駅も同じように市街地の縁にあってどちらも利便性が悪かったことと、沿線の人口も前述のような理由で多くなかったことから、利用客が伸びずに同社はもっとひどい苦境に陥った。
sen.e: In addition, the company had to face serious troubles due to the failure in attracting users, because Shinkeihan Railway's terminal station, Saiin Station, was a provisional setup and the station itself as well as Tenjinbashi Station in the Osaka side, located at the edge of the city, could not provide convenience for the users, and moreover, the population along the line was scares for the reason previously mentioned.

sen.j: 沿線の人口が少ないため同線は都市間輸送に注力するしかなく、天神橋～大宮間を34分で結ぶ超特急などといった高速運転を行う列車を集中的に走らせることにした。

sen.e: On the other hand, the Keihan Main Line, instead of setting up rapid reaching trains, enhanced the Express and Local train services, and in this way they tried to seek a compartmentalization of the operational focus between the inter-urban transportation and the wayside transportation (transportation for users along the line).

sen.e: Its velocity was so exceptional that there was an anecdote that a rapid reaching train of Hankyu Railway Type 100 was capable of getting ahead of the limited express "Tsubame," the fastest train the Japanese Government Railways had at that time (please refer to the section "Development of Hankyu Type 100").

sen.j: また、1937年に国鉄東海道本線京都駅～吹田駅 (JR西日本)間の電化が完成（吹田駅～須磨駅間は1934年に完成）し、京阪間を直行便の36分で結ぶ新快速が走るようになると、京阪では両線ともに列車の本数を増やし、運賃の値下げまで行うなどして対抗した。
sen.e: In 1937, when the section between Kyoto Station on the JNR Tokaido Main Line and Suita Station (JR West) was fully electrified (the electrification between Suita Station and Suma Station was completed in 1934) and direct trains started to connect between Kyoto and Osaka in 36 minutes, Keihan competed by increasing the number of trains on the both lines and cutting down the fares.

In 1937, when the section between Kyoto Station on the JNR Tokaido Main Line and Suita Station (JR West) was fully electrified (the electrification between Suita Station and Suma Station was completed in 1934) and direct trains started connecting between Kyoto and Osaka in 36 minutes, Keihan competed by increasing the number of trains on both lines and reducing the fares.

In 1937, when the section between Kyoto Station on the JNR Tokaido Main Line and Suita Station (JR West) was fully electrified (the electrification between Suita Station and Suma Station was completed in 1934) and special rapid trains started connecting between Kyoto and Osaka in 36 minutes, Keihan competed by increasing the number of trains on both lines and reducing the fares.

sen.j: さらに1934年からは、天神橋駅～大宮駅間運転の列車のほか、同列車と淡路駅で解結を行うことにして、阪急線と接続させるため十三駅を発着駅にする列車も設定した。
sen.e: From 1934, in addition to the introduction of the train connecting Tenjinmashi Station and Omiya Station, the train service starting from and terminating at Juso Station was introduced in order to make a connection with the Hankyu Line, by coupling and decoupling this train at Awaji Station.

From 1934, in addition to the introduction of the train connecting Tenjinmashi Station and Omiya Station, the train service starting from and terminating at Juso Station was introduced in order to make a connection with the Hankyu Line by coupling and decoupling this train at Awaji Station.

From 1934, in addition to the introduction of the train connecting Tenjinbashi Station and Omiya Station, the train service arriving at and departing from Juso Station was introduced in order to make a connection with the Hankyu Line by coupling and decoupling this train at Awaji Station.
sen.cmt: Tenjinbashiに修正"starting from and terminating at"→"arriving at and departing from"に変更しました。

tit.j: 京阪神急行電鉄への統合後
tit.e: After the integration to Keihanshin Express Railway
tit.cmt: 京阪神急行電鉄→Keihanshin Express Railway [http://www.rokko1go.jpn.org/main/photo/english/eng_jpnkind1.html]
tit.e: After the integration to Keihanshin Express Railway
After the integration to Keihanshin Express Railway

sen.j: 戦時中の交通統制のため、京阪電気鉄道と阪神急行電鉄は1943年に合併して京阪神急行電鉄（現在の阪急電鉄）となり、新京阪線も同社の運営となった。
sen.e: During the war, to control the traffic, Keihan Electric Railway and Hanshin Electric Express Railway merged into Keihanshin Express Railway (current Hankyu Corporation）, and the Shinkeihan Line was also put under this company's management.
sen.cmt: 阪神急行電鉄→Hanshin Electric Express Railway [http//www.jrtr.net/jrtr08/history.html]
sen.e: During the war, in order to control traffic, Keihan Electric Railway and Hanshin Electric Express Railway merged into Keihanshin Express Railway (currently Hankyu Corporation) and the Shinkeihan Line was put under this company's management.

During the war, in order to control traffic, in 1943, Keihan Electric Railway and Hanshin Electric Express Railway merged into Keihanshin Express Railway (currently Hankyu Corporation) and the Shinkeihan Line was put under this company's management.

sen.j: 戦後、京阪電気鉄道は1949年に再び分離発足することになるが、この際に新京阪線の電車は1945年から宝塚線へ乗り入れを行って梅田駅発着となっていたことなどの理由から、同線と支線の千里山線（現在の千里線の淡路以北）・十三支線（現在の京都本線の淡路以西）・阪急嵐山線は阪急の路線として存置することになった。
sen.e: After the war, Keihan Electric Railway separated again as an independent entity in 1949, however, the Shinkeihan Line and its 3 feeder lines, the Senriyama Line (the section from Awaji Station and to the north of the current Senri Line), the Juso Feeder Line (the section from Awaji Station and to the west of the current Kyoto Main Line) and the Hankyu Arashiyama Line, remained as a railway of Hankyu Corporation, for the reasons that the trains of the Shinkeihan Line had shared the track of the Takarazuka Line since 1945, and they started from and terminated at Umeda Station, etc.

After the war, Keihan Electric Railway separated again as an independent entity in 1949; however, the Shinkeihan Line and its three feeder lines, the Senriyama Line (the section from Awaji Station and to the north of the current Senri Line), the Juso feeder line (the section from Awaji Station and to the west of the current Kyoto Main Line) and the Hankyu Arashiyama Line, remained as a railway of Hankyu Corporation because the trains of the Shinkeihan Line had shared the track of the Takarazuka Line since 1945, starting from and terminating at Umeda Station, etc.

After the war, Keihan Electric Railway separated again as an independent entity in 1949; however, the Shinkeihan Line and its three feeder lines, the Senriyama Line (the section from Awaji Station and to the north of the current Senri Line), the Juso feeder line (the section from Awaji Station and to the west of the current Kyoto Main Line) and the Hankyu Arashiyama Line, remained as a railway of Hankyu Corporation because the trains of the Shinkeihan Line had shared the track of the Takarazuka Line since 1945, arriving at and departing from Umeda Station, etc.
sen.cmt: "starting from and terminating at"→"arriving at and departing from"に変更しました。

sen.j: このとき、路線名が現在の京都本線となった。
sen.e: At that time the denomination of the line became the actual denomination, Kyoto Main Line.
At that time the denomination of the line became the actual denomination, Kyoto Main Line.
At that time the denomination of the line became the actual denomination, Kyoto Main Line.

sen.j: またこのような経緯から、京都本線系統の路線を除いた阪急各線をその頭一字を取って神宝線と総称し、お互いを区別することがある。
sen.e: And due to such a background, the lines belonging to Hankyu Railway except the lines included in the Kyoto Main Line system, are sometimes called Jinpo Line, after the combination of the first Chinese letter of the lines, in order to distinguish one from another.

Given such a background, the lines belonging to Hankyu Railway (except for the lines included in the Kyoto Main Line system) are sometimes called the Jinpo Line, after the combination of the first Chinese letter of the lines, in order to distinguish one from the other.

Given such a background, the lines belonging to Hankyu Railway (except for the lines included in the Kyoto Main Line system) are sometimes called the Jinpo Line, after the combination of the first Chinese letter of the lines, in order to distinguish one from the other.

sen.j: 路線名が京都本線に改称されてからも、京都本線の起点は長らく天神橋駅のままであったが、いわゆる三複線（宝塚本線の梅田－十三間複々線化工事）が完成したのを機に、天神橋－淡路間を千里山線に変更するとともに、京都本線は十三支線を編入し十三が起点となった。
sen.e: Even after the line's denomination was changed to Kyoto Main Line, Tenmabashi Station had been maintained as the starting station during a long time, however, following the completion of so called sextuple-tracked work (quadruple-tracked work between Umeda Station and Juso Station on the Takarazuka Line), the section between Tenjinbashi Station and Awaji Station was changed to be the Senriyama Line, and the Kyoto Main Line, incorporating the Juso Line, designated Juso Station as its starting point.

Even after the line's denomination was changed to Kyoto Main Line, Tenmabashi Station had been maintained as the starting station during a long time; however, following the completion of the so-called sextuple-track work (quadruple-track work between Umeda Station and Juso Station on the Takarazuka Line), the section between Tenjinbashi Station and Awaji Station was changed to be the Senriyama Line, and the Kyoto Main Line, incorporating the Juso Line, designated Juso Station as its starting point.

Even after the line's denomination was changed to "Kyoto Main Line," Tenjinbashi Station was for a long time maintained as the starting station; however, following the completion of the so-called sextuple-track work (quadruple-track work between Umeda Station and Juso Station on the Takarazuka Line), the section between Tenjinbashi Station and Awaji Station became known as the Senriyama Line, and the Kyoto Main Line, incorporating the Juso Line, designated Juso Station as its starting point.

sen.j: 上牧駅 (大阪府)前後から大山崎駅にかけて一部高架区間があるが、これは並行する東海道新幹線の建設に併せて造られたもので、高架化工事中の1963年4月から12月までの間、先に完成していた東海道新幹線の高架線路を借りて列車の運行を行っていたことがある。
sen.e: From around Kammaki Station to Oyamazaki Station, there is an elevated section, which was made in connection with the construction of Tokaido Shinkansen running in parallel, and during the period of the elevation work from April to December 1963, the company hired the elevated tracks of the Tokaido Shinkansen, which had already been constructed at that time, to operate the trains using them.

From around Kammaki Station to Oyamazaki Station, there is an elevated section, which was made in connection with the construction of Tokaido Shinkansen running in parallel, and during the period of the elevation work from April to December 1963 the company hired the elevated tracks of the Tokaido Shinkansen, which had already been constructed at that time, in order to operate the trains using them.

From around Kanmaki Station (Osaka Prefecture) to Oyamazaki Station, there is an elevated section, which was made in connection with the construction of the Tokaido Shinkansen running in parallel, and during the period of the elevation work from April to December 1963 the company hired the elevated tracks of the Tokaido Shinkansen, which had already been constructed at that time, in order to operate the trains using them.

sen.j: 東海道新幹線新幹線の線路を先に走った阪急電車の項目も参照。
sen.e: Please refer to the section "Hankyu trains that ran first on the railway of the Tokaido Shinkansen.
Please refer to the section on "Hankyu trains that ran first on the railway of the Tokaido Shinkansen."
Please refer to the section on Hankyu trains that ran first on the railway of the Tokaido Shinkansen.

sen.j: 東海道本線とは当初から互いにスピード競争を行って乗客獲得競争を行っていたが、国鉄末期以降はスピードアップや新型車両投入により、スピード競争では敗北し、さらにJR化後は新快速を高槻駅に停車させるなど、スピードを維持したまま停車駅を増やしたため、阪急京都線も途中駅にこまめに停車して集客する方法に方針転換する。
sen.e: The line had been competing over higher speeds with the Tokaido Main Line to attract passengers, however since the late stage of the Japan National Railway time, the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line had been left behind in speed competitions owing to JNR's intensified investment in speeding up and developing new types of rolling stocks, and moreover, after the privatization to East Japan Railway Company, the Tokaido Main Line increased the number of stops, for example, making the Special Rapid train stop at Takatsuki Station, while maintaining its velocity, and, therefore, Hankyu Kyoto Line also had to change its policy to increase more stops in between to attract the passengers.
sen.cmt: 新快速→Special Rapid、JR化→定訳不明：the privatization to East Japan Railway Company [東海道本線の話なのでJR東日本化と解釈しました。] →定訳不明: privatization of Japan National Railway
sen.e: The line had been competing over higher speeds with the Tokaido Main Line to attract passengers; however, since the late stage of the Japan National Railway time, the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line had been left behind in speed competitions owing to JNR's intensified investment in speeding up and developing new types of rolling stock, and moreover, after the privatization to East Japan Railway Company, the Tokaido Main Line increased the number of stops, for example by making the special rapid train stop at Takatsuki Station, while maintaining its velocity, and therefore Hankyu Kyoto Line also had to change its policy to increase more stops in between to attract the passengers.

The line had been competing over higher speeds with the Tokaido Main Line in order to attract passengers, but since the late stage of the Japan National Railway the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line had been left behind in speed competitions owing to JNR's intensified investment in speeding up and developing new types of rolling stock, and after the privatization of Japan National Railway, the Tokaido Main Line increased the number of stops, for example by making the special rapid train stop at Takatsuki Station, while maintaining its velocity; therefore, the Hankyu Kyoto Line also had to change its policy to increase the number of stops in between as a means to attract passengers.
sen.cmt: JR化後 修正"Hankyu Kyoto Line"→"the Hankyu Kyoto Line"に変更しました。

sen.j: まず1989年にすべての電車が15分ヘッドであったものを、特急を20分おきに減便し、急行を10分おきへと増便した。
sen.e: First of all, the interval that was capped by 15 minutes for all trains in 1997 was changed, and the number of limited express trains was reduced by operating with 20-minute interval, while the number of Express was increased by operating with 10-minute interval.

First of all, the interval that was capped by 15 minutes for all trains in 1997 was changed, and the number of limited express trains was reduced by operating with 20-minute intervals, while the number of express was increased by operating with 10-minute intervals.

First of all, the interval that was capped by 15 minutes for all trains in 1989 was changed, and the number of limited express trains was reduced by operating with 20-minute intervals, while the number of express was increased by operating with 10-minute intervals.

sen.j: 1997年にはすべての特急が高槻市停車となった。
sen.e: In 1997, all the limited express trains began making a stop at Takatsuki Station.
In 1997, all the limited express trains began making stops at Takatsuki Station.
In 1997, all the limited express trains began making stops at Takatsukishi Station.

sen.j: 2001年3月24日のダイヤ改正では大幅な停車駅の見直しと種別の整理が行われた。
sen.e: In the timetable revision made on March 24, 2001, drastic readjustment of stops and restructure of types of train were carried out.
In the timetable revision of March 24, 2001, the drastic readjustment of stops and restructuring of types of trains was carried out.
In the timetable revision of March 24, 2001, the drastic readjustment of stops and restructuring of types of trains was carried out.

sen.j: 特急を通勤特急に、快速急行を快速特急に、急行を快速急行に、快速を急行に改称の上で南茨木にも停車させ、特急は停車駅を快速特急よりも多く快速急行よりも少なくして、各優等列車の停車駅を従来のほぼ2倍にし、特急を事実上それまでの急行と同等の列車にした（この点については2007年の淡路駅の追加停車でその様相がさらに色濃くなった）。
sen.e: The followings points were changed: The denomination of limited express was changed to Commuter Limited Express, Rapid Express to Rapid limited express, Express to Rapid Express, Rapid to Express, respectively; All types of train were made to stop at Minami-ibaraki Station; limited express would have more stops then Rapid limited express and fewer stops than Rapid Express; Each type of higher category trains would have nearly twice as many stops as before; limited express became practically the same grade as the former Express (This characteristic became more clear, when Awaji Station was designated as an additional stop in 2007).
sen.cmt: 各優等列車→定訳不明：each type of higher category trainsとしました。
sen.e: The following points were changed: the denomination of limited express was changed to Commuter Limited Express, rapid express to rapid limited express, express to rapid express, rapid to express, respectively; all types of train were made to stop at Minami-Baraka Station; limited express would have more stops then rapid limited express and fewer stops than rapid express; each type of higher-category train would have nearly twice as many stops as before; limited express became practically the same grade as the former express (this characteristic became more clear, when Awaji Station was designated as an additional stop in 2007).

The following points were changed: the denomination of limited express was changed to Commuter Limited Express, rapid express to rapid limited express, express to rapid express and rapid to express, respectively; express was made to stop at Minami-ibaraki Station; limited express would have more stops than rapid limited express but fewer stops than rapid express; each type of higher-category train would have nearly twice as many stops as before; limited express became practically the same grade as the former express (this characteristic became more clear when Awaji Station was designated as an additional stop in 2007).
sen.cmt: 急行が南茨木に停車する、 のように修正

sen.j: 同時に準急と行楽期の嵯峨野エクスプレスを廃止。
sen.e: At the same time, Semi Express and "Sagano Express" in the tourist seasons were discontinued.
At the same time, semi-express and "Sagano Express" in the tourist seasons were discontinued.
At the same time, the semi-express and Sagano Express in the tourist seasons were discontinued.

sen.j: 行楽期の臨時特急を新設した。
sen.e: The special limited express train service during the tourist seasons was newly set up.
The special limited express train service during the tourist seasons was established.
The special limited express train service during the tourist seasons was established.

sen.j: また河原町駅の2番ホームを除く線内全駅が8両編成対応となった。
sen.e: And all the platforms within the whole line, except Platform No.2 at Kawaramachi Station became accessible by the 8-car train.
Additionally, all the platforms within the entire line, except for Platform 2 at Kawaramachi Station, became accessible by the eight-car train.
Additionally, all the platforms within the entire line, except for Platform 2 at Kawaramachi Station, became accessible by the eight-car train.

sen.j: これにより高槻市から河原町までの区間において平日ダイヤの昼間は一部列車が減便（従来の特急は実質廃止）。
sen.e: Consequently, the trains operated based on the daytime schedule were partially reduced in number in the section between Takatsukishi Station and Kawaramachi Station (the conventional Limited Train was practically discontinued).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Consequently, the trains operated based on the daytime schedule were partially reduced in number in the section between Takatsukishi Station and Kawaramachi Station (the conventional limited train was practically discontinued).

Consequently, the trains operated based on the daytime schedule were partially reduced in number on the section between Takatsukishi Station and Kawaramachi Station (the conventional limited express train was practically discontinued).

sen.j: 休日ダイヤでも京阪間直通優等列車の総本数は減少（特急・急行で1時間当たり8本が特急6本に。25%減少）した。
sen.e: And on the time schedule for holidays, the total number of the higher category trains operated directly between Kyoto and Osaka was reduced (8 limited express/Express trains an hour were reduced by 25 % to 6 limited express trains).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Regarding the time schedule for holidays, the total number of the higher-category trains operated directly between Kyoto and Osaka was reduced (eight limited express/express trains an hour were reduced by 25% to six limited express trains).

Regarding the time schedule for holidays, the total number of the higher-category trains operated directly between Kyoto and Osaka was reduced (eight limited express/express trains an hour were reduced by 25% to six limited express trains).

sen.j: また、特急の所要時間も十三～大宮間ノンストップ時代の38分から5～6分延びて、下り44分、上り43分が標準的な所要時間となっており、これは2001年3月23日以前の急行の所要時間と2～3分程度しか変わらない程スピードダウンしている。
sen.e: The required time of the limited express train also increased by 5 to 6 minutes from 38 minutes to 44 minutes, and the up train requires an average of 43 minutes, which is such a considerable slow down that there is only 2- or 3-minute difference from the time that it took the Express train on February 23, 2001 or before.

The required time of the limited express train also increased by five to six minutes from 38 minutes to 44 minutes, and the up train requires an average of 43 minutes, which is such a considerable slow down that there is only two- or three-minute difference from the time it took the express train on February 23, 2001 or before.

The required time of the limited express train also increased by five to six minutes from 38 minutes when it ran nonstop from Juso to Omiya: now the outbound train requires 44 minutes and the inbound train requires 43 minutes on average, which is such a considerable slowdown that there is only a two- or three-minute difference from the time it took the express train on February 23, 2001 or before.
sen.cmt: 十三～大宮間ノンストップ時代 追加 上り、下りをinbound, outboundに修正

sen.j: 1921年（大正10年）4月1日 北大阪電気鉄道が十三～淡路～豊津間を開業。
sen.e: April 1, 1921: Kita Osaka Electric Railway (Kitaosaka Denki-tetsudo) started the operation between Juso Station, Awaji Station and Toyotsu Station.

October 15, 1925: Shinkeihan Railway opened the section between Tenjinbashi (current Tenjinbashisuji-rokuchome Station) and Awaji Station.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）1月16日 淡路～高槻町（現在の高槻市）間が開業。

sen.j: 全線の架線電圧を600Vから1500Vに昇圧。

sen.j: 途中淡路のみの停車（行楽期は嵐山線との接続駅である桂にも停車）で京阪間を34分にて結んだ。
sen.e: In between, the train made only one stop at Awaji Station (during the tourist seasons, it also stopped at Katsura Station, which was a station connecting with the Arashiyama Line) and connected Kyoto and Osaka in 34 minutes.

September 15, 1930: Keihan Electric Railway swallowed Shinkeihan Railway.

sen.j: 天神橋～西院間が新京阪線、十三～淡路間が十三（支）線となる。
sen.e: The section between Tenjinbashi Station and Saiin Station became the Shinkeihan Line, and the section between Juso Station and Awaji Station became the Juso (feeder) Line.
The section between Tenjinbashi Station and Saiin Station became the Shinkeihan Line, and the section between Juso Station and Awaji Station became the Juso (feeder) Line.

sen.e: Suita Station changed its name to Keihan Suita Station.
Suita Station changed its name to Keihan Suita Station.

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年）3月31日 関西初の地下線として西院～京阪京都（現在の大宮）間が開業。

sen.j: 2001年（平成13年）3月24日 ダイヤ改正により、開業以来続いた列車体系を大幅に変更し、従来の特急を通勤特急に、快速急行を快速特急に改称、停車駅が快速特急より多く快速急行より少ない特急および行楽期の臨時特急を新設。
sen.e: March 24, 2001: With the timetable revision, the train operation system that had been practiced since the inauguration underwent the drastic changes as follows; the denomination of the conventional limited express was changed to Commuter Express, and Rapid Express to Rapid limited express, respectively; limited express and Special limited express operated in the tourist seasons with more stops than the Rapid limited express and fewer stops than Rapid Express, were introduced.

March 24, 2001: With the timetable revision, the train operation system that had been practiced since the inauguration underwent the drastic changes as follows; the denomination of the conventional limited express was changed to the Commuter Express, and rapid express to rapid limited express, respectively; limited express and special limited express operated in the tourist seasons with more stops than the rapid limited express and fewer stops than rapid express, were introduced.

March 24, 2001: With the timetable revision, the train operation system that had been practiced since the inauguration underwent the following drastic changes: the denomination of the conventional limited express was changed to the Commuter Limited Express and the rapid express to rapid limited express, respectively; and the limited express and special limited express, which operated in the tourist seasons with more stops than the rapid limited express but fewer stops than rapid express, were introduced.
sen.cmt: Commuter Limited Express としました。

sen.j: また、従来の急行を快速急行に、快速を急行に改称の上、南茨木駅にも追加停車。
sen.e: Also the denomination of the conventional Express was changed to Rapid Express, and Rapid to Express, respectively, and they began making a stop at Minami-ibaraki Station in addition.
Also, the denomination of the conventional express was changed to rapid express, and rapid to express, respectively, and they began making stops at Minami-Baraka Station as well.
Also, the denomination of the conventional express was changed to rapid express and rapid to express, respectively, and they began making stops at Minami-ibaraki Station as well.

sen.j: また、準急と行楽期の嵯峨野エクスプレスを廃止。
sen.e: Semi Express and "Sagano Express" operated in the tourist seasons were discontinued.
The semi-express and "Sagano Express," which had operated in the tourist seasons, were discontinued.
The semi-express and Sagano Express, which had operated in the tourist seasons, were discontinued.

sen.j: 平日・土休日とも、昼間は特急・急行・普通を10分間隔で運転。
sen.e: On weekdays as well as on Sundays and holidays, limited express, Express, and Local trains were operated with 10-minute interval during the daytime.
On weekdays as well as on Sundays and holidays, limited express, express and local trains were operated with 10-minute interval during the daytime.
On weekdays, Saturdays and holidays, the limited express, express and local trains were operated at 10-minute intervals during the daytime.

sen.j: この結果従来の特急と急行が統合され、高槻市から河原町までは減便を達成。
sen.e: Consequently, the conventional limited express and Express were integrated to reduce the number of trains in the section from Takatsuki Station to Kawaramachi Station.
Consequently, the conventional limited express and express were integrated to reduce the number of trains in the section from Takatsuki Station to Kawaramachi Station.
Consequently, the conventional limited express and express were integrated in order to reduce the number of trains in the section from Takatsukishi Station to Kawaramachi Station.

sen.j: 2001年（平成13年）11月11日 行楽期の臨時特急に「いい古都エクスプレス」の愛称を付けて運転を開始。
sen.e: November 11, 2001: Special limited express for the tourist seasons, nicknamed as "Ii Koto Express" started its service.
November 11, 2001: The special limited express for the tourist seasons, nicknamed the "Ii Koto Express," started its service.
November 11, 2001: The special limited express for the tourist seasons, nicknamed the 'Ii Koto Express,' started its service.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）3月16日 洛西口駅が開業。
sen.e: March 16, 2003: Rakusaiguchi Station opened.
March 16, 2003: Rakusaiguchi Station opened.
March 16, 2003: Rakusaiguchi Station opened.

sen.j: 廃止された物集女駅跡地とほぼ同じ位置。
sen.e: This was constructed on nearly the same site as Mozume Station was located.
This was constructed on nearly the same site as that of Mozume Station.
This was constructed on nearly the same site as that of the closed Mozume Station.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）3月17日 特急が淡路に停車し、従来の急行を南方、上新庄に停車させて準急とするなど、6年ぶりの大幅な改正が行なわれた。
sen.e: March 17, 2007: Following a substantial revision made for the first time after 6 years, limited express began making a stop at Awaji Station, the conventional Express was converted to Semi Express by designating additional stops at Minamigata Station and Kami-shinjo Station, etc.

March 17, 2007: Following a substantial revision made for the first time after six years, the limited express began making stops at Awaji Station, the conventional express was converted to a semi-express by designating additional stops at Minamigata Station and Kami-shinjo Station, etc.

March 17, 2007: Following a substantial revision made for the first time after six years, the limited express began making stops at Awaji Station and the conventional express was converted to a semi-express by designating additional stops at Minamikata Station and Kami-shinjo Station, etc.

sen.j: 同時に行楽期のいい古都エクスプレスも臨時特急から臨時快速に格下げされる。
sen.e: "Ii Koto Express" operated during the tourist seasons was also degraded from Special Express to Special Rapid.
"Ii Koto Express" operated during the tourist seasons was also degraded from a special express to a special rapid.
Ii Koto Express, which operated during the tourist seasons, was also downgraded from a special express to a special rapid.

sen.j: 阪急電鉄の西院駅は「さいいん」、京福電気鉄道の西院駅は「さい」と読む。
sen.e: A station of Hankyu Railway, written in Japanese 「西院」, is pronounced as "Saiin," while the station of Keifuku Electric Railroad that is written with the same characters is pronounced as "Sai."
sen.cmt: 京福電気鉄道→Keifuku Electric Railroad [http://www.keifuku.co.jp/]
sen.e: A station of Hankyu Railway, written in Japanese 「西院」, is pronounced "Saiin," while the station of Keifuku Electric Railroad that is written with the same characters is pronounced "Sai."
A station of Hankyu Railway, written in Japanese as 西院, is pronounced 'Saiin,' while the station of Keifuku Electric Railroad, which is written with the same characters, is pronounced 'Sai.'

sen.j: 西院駅参照。
sen.e: Please refer to the section "Saiin Station."
Please refer to the section "Saiin Station."
Please refer to the section on Saiin Station.

sen.j: 梅田駅ではJR東西線北新地駅との乗り換えには20分程度かかる。
sen.e: From Umeda Station, it takes about 20 minutes to transfer to the JR Tozai Line at Kitashinchi Station.
sen.cmt: 「梅田駅では」→JR北新地駅は阪急梅田駅構内にはないので、「梅田駅からは」と解釈しました。
sen.e: From Umeda Station, it takes about 20 minutes to transfer to the JR Tozai Line at Kitashinchi Station.
From Umeda Station, it takes about 20 minutes to transfer to the JR Tozai Line at Kitashinchi Station.

sen.j: 大阪市営地下鉄との連絡切符（天神橋筋六丁目駅経由指定のもの）を使う場合、梅田駅（含・東梅田駅、西梅田駅）、南方駅 (大阪府)（含・西中島南方駅）の地下鉄線との乗り継ぎは出来ない。
sen.e: In case of the connection ticket to Osaka City Subway (the ticket must be the one through Tenjinbashisuji-Rokuchome Station), it is not accepted for making a transfer to the subway line at Minamigata Station (Osaka Prefecture) (including Nishinakajima-Minamigata Station).
sen.cmt: 連絡切符→connection ticket [英辞郎on the WEB]
sen.e: In the case of the connection ticket to Osaka City Subway (the ticket must be the one through Tenjinbashisuji-Rokuchome Station), it is not accepted for making a transfer to the subway line at Minamigata Station (Osaka Prefecture) (including Nishinakajima-Minamigata Station).

In the case of the connection ticket to Osaka Municipal Subway (the ticket must be the one through Tenjinbashisuji-rokuchome Station), it isn't permitted to make a transfer to the subway line at Minamikata Station (Osaka Prefecture) (including Nishinakajima-Minamigata Station).

sen.j: 南海電気鉄道の関西空港駅への切符もそのルールが適用され、天下茶屋駅での乗り継ぎがルートとして見なされている。
sen.e: This rule is also applied to the ticket to Kansai-Airport Station of Nankai electric Railway
sen.cmt: 南海電気鉄道→Nankai Electric Railway [http://www.nankai.co.jp/global/index/html]
sen.e: This rule is also applied to the ticket to Kansai-Airport Station of Nankai Electric Railway
This rule also applies to the ticket to Kansai-Airport Station of Nankai Electric Railway, which designates the transfer route via Tengachaya Station.
sen.cmt: 未完の文章を補足しました

sen.j: 以下の区間において新駅を設置することが発表されている。
sen.e: In the following sections, construction of new stations has been announced.
The construction of new stations is announced in the following sections:
The construction of new stations is announced in the following sections:

sen.j: 大山崎～長岡天神間の京都第二外環状道路（国道478号線バイパス高速道路の京都縦貫自動車道。計画中）との交差地点に新駅を設置することが長岡京市と阪急電鉄の間で2005年11月に合意された（但し、着工、開業予定などは未定）。
sen.e: Nagaokakyo City and Hankyu Corporation reached an agreement to construct a station on the cross over point of this Hankyu line and the 2nd outbound belt highway (Kyoto Jukan Expressway (or Trans Kyoto Expressway) that bypasses National Route 478; in the planning stage) (However, the date of the commencement and inauguration are not still determined).

Nagaokakyo City and Hankyu Corporation reached an agreement to construct a station on the crossover point of this Hankyu line and the second outbound belt highway (Kyoto Jukan Expressway (or Trans Kyoto Expressway) that bypasses National Route 478; in the planning stage) (However, the commencement and inauguration dates are yet to be determined).

Nagaokakyo City and Hankyu Corporation reached an agreement in November 2005 to construct a new station on the crossover point of this Hankyu line and the second outbound belt highway (Kyoto Jukan Expressway (or Trans Kyoto Expressway) that bypasses National Route 478; in the planning stage) between Oyamazaki Station and Nagaoka-tenjin Station (However, the commencement and inauguration dates are yet to be determined).
sen.cmt: 大山崎～長岡天神間 年表 追加

sen.j: また洛西口駅も高架化が決定した。
sen.e: The elevation of Rakusaiguchi Station was also determined.
The elevation of Rakusaiguchi Station was also determined.
The elevation of Rakusaiguchi Station was also determined.

sen.j: 2006年5月26日に、正雀～南茨木間の摂津市千里丘東4丁目～南千里丘の境界付近に新駅を設置することが阪急電鉄と摂津市によって発表された。
sen.e: May 26, 2006: The construction of a new station around the boundary of the two district, Senrioka-higashi (Settsu City) and Minami Senrioka, along the section between Shojaku Station and Minami Ibaraki Station, was announced.

May 26, 2006: The construction of a new station around the boundary of the two district, Senrioka-higashi (Settsu City) and Minami Senrioka, along the section between Shojaku Station and Minami Ibaraki Station, was announced.

May 26, 2006: The construction of a new station around the boundary of the two district, 4-chome of Senrioka-higashi in Settsu City and Minami Senrioka, along the section between Shojaku Station and Minami-ibaraki Station, was announced.

sen.j: 開業予定は2010年春頃。
sen.e: The inauguration is roughly scheduled in spring 2010.
The inauguration is generally scheduled for spring 2010.
The inauguration is generally scheduled for spring 2010.

sen.j: 2004年10月の近畿地方交通審議会答申第8号において、京都線と神戸線の相互直通運転が「既存施設の改良に関し検討すべき主な事業」のひとつに挙げられている。
sen.e: In the 8th report of the Kinki Regional Transportation Council in October 2004, direct interoperation between the Kyoto Line and the Kobe Line is placed as one of "the principle programs to be studied concerning the improvement of existing facilities."
sen.cmt: 近畿地方交通審議会答申第8号→定訳不明： the 8th report forwarded by the Kinki Regional Transportation Council ["近畿地方交通審議会答申"については英辞郎on the WEBを参照しました。]
sen.e: In the eighth report of the Kinki Regional Transportation Council in October 2004, direct interoperation between the Kyoto Line and the Kobe Line is placed as one of "the principle programs to be studied concerning the improvement of existing facilities."

In the eighth report of the Kinki Regional Transportation Council in October 2004, direct interoperation between the Kyoto Line and the Kobe Line is positioned as one of 'the principle programs to be studied concerning the improvement of existing facilities.'

sen.j: なお、神戸線との直通列車は、かつて神戸線・阪急今津線経由で京都～宝塚間を直通する「歌劇特急」や、それとは別に戦後から昭和30年代までは、神戸～京都間を直通する特急があった。
sen.e: At one time, there were through trains operated to and from the Kobe Line; one was "Kageki-tokkyu" (limited express) that directly connected Kyoto and Takarazuka, passing through the Kobe Line and the Hankyu Imazu Line, and the other was a limited express train that was directly operated between Kobe and Kyoto from the post-war period until the 30s of the Showa era (around a decade from 1955).

At one time there were through-trains operated to and from the Kobe Line; one was "Kageki-tokkyu" (limited express) that directly connected Kyoto and Takarazuka, passing through the Kobe Line and the Hankyu Imazu Line, and the other was a limited express train that was directly operated between Kobe and Kyoto from the post-war period until the 30s of the Showa era (for around a decade from 1955).

At one time there were through-trains operating to and from the Kobe Line; one was 'Kageki-tokkyu' (limited express), which directly connected Kyoto and Takarazuka, passing through the Kobe Line and the Hankyu Imazu Line, and the other was a limited express train, which was directly operated between Kobe and Kyoto from the post-war period until the 1930s of the Showa period (for about a decade from 1955).
